triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is the primary social media platform used to collect the political communication data analyzed in the study.

triples.name: Community structure
triples.relevance: Network clustering algorithms for detecting community structure are used to analyze the partisan organization of retweet and mention networks.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: Social network analysis provides the foundational methodology for analyzing the topological properties of political communication networks.

triples.name: Political polarization
triples.relevance: The paper proposes new empirical evidence about political polarization by demonstrating highly segregated partisan structures in retweet networks.

triples.name: Graph partition
triples.relevance: Graph partitioning concepts underlie the network clustering algorithms used to identify partisan divisions in the political communication networks.
